description: A grouping of individuals in a society based on economic terms (e.g., income, wealth, occupation), if applicable.
Measurement classification of the variable (ex. estimate, margin of error).
Unit of measurement for the reported value.
Unique ILO identifier for the subject and frequency of the ILO variable.
Human-readable unique name for the variable.
A range of ages, if applicable.
A settlement or land use classification (e.g., Rural, Urban), if applicable.
An industry classification based on type of production and market served, if applicable.
A person's regular, main work or profession, if applicable.
A classification of the status of individuals based on their role in the workforce, if applicable.
Unique identifier for a variable, joinable to the timeseries table.
Quantifiable attribute or subject; description of what is being recorded.
